Pre-Game Insights: India holds a dominant head-to-head record against Bangladesh.
Bangladesh is facing a must-win situation after a loss to Australia.
Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma need to convert starts into significant scores.
Shivam Dube faces pressure with Sanju Samson waiting in the wings.
Hardik Pandya's cameo against Afghanistan offers a positive sign.
India's bowling attack relies on left-arm spinners, exploiting Caribbean wickets.
Bangladesh's batting woes and lack of power-hitters are a concern.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Match starts at 10:30 a.m. local time (ET)
Venue: North Sound, Antigua, Sir Vivian Richards Stadium
Teams: India vs. Bangladesh in Super 8 Group 1
Previous performances: India has won against Ireland, Pakistan, and USA, with a match abandoned against Canada.
Others: Fans can watch the match live on Fubo (free trial) and Sling TV.
WillowTV is available on cable and through streaming services.
A VPN can be used to bypass geographical restrictions.
